skill.name: competitive-ads-extractor
skill.description: Extracts and analyzes competitors' ads from ad libraries (Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.) to understand what messaging, problems, and creative approaches are working. Helps inspire and improve your own ad campaigns.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance text. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file system access, or external command execution capabilities. The skill provides a framework for researching competitor ads using Claude's natural language capabilities.

content.user_title: Research competitor ad strategies and messaging
content.value_statement: Understanding competitor advertising strategies helps you create more effective campaigns. This skill provides a structured approach to researching and analyzing competitor ads from public ad libraries to discover what messaging and creative approaches resonate with your target audience.
actual_capabilities: Extract and analyze competitor ads from Facebook Ad Library
Research LinkedIn ads for B2B positioning strategies
Identify successful messaging patterns and pain points highlighted by competitors
Categorize ads by theme, audience segment, and creative format
Compare multiple competitors to find common patterns and differentiation opportunities
Generate actionable insights for improving your own ad campaigns
limitations: Does not provide real-time scraping or automated data collection from ad platforms
Analysis quality depends on the information you provide about competitors
Cannot access private ad accounts or restricted data
Does not directly retrieve engagement metrics or performance data

use_cases.title: Ad Campaign Planning
use_cases.description: Research competitor messaging to identify successful patterns and find gaps in the market for your own campaigns.

use_cases.title: Competitive Positioning
use_cases.description: Understand how competitors position their products and discover underserved audience needs.

use_cases.title: Creative Inspiration
use_cases.description: Find inspiration for your ad creative by analyzing what visual styles and copy formulas work in your industry.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Ad Extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all current ads from [Competitor Name] on Facebook Ad Library and analyze their key messaging themes.

prompt_templates.title: Pain Point Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Get ads from [Competitor] focusing on their messaging about [specific problem]. What pain points are they highlighting?

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Competitor Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract ads from these competitors: [list]. Compare their approaches and identify what messaging strategies are working across the competitive set.

prompt_templates.title: Platform-Specific Research
prompt_templates.prompt: Get LinkedIn ads from [Competitor] and analyze their B2B positioning strategy, target audiences, and value propositions.

output_examples.input: Extract ads from Notion on Facebook Ad Library and tell me what messaging is working for them.
output: Total ads found with primary themes breakdown
Key problems highlighted in competitor messaging
Successful creative patterns with visual examples
Best performing copy formulas and headlines

best_practices: Research multiple competitors to understand industry-wide messaging patterns and find differentiation opportunities.
Track competitor ads over time to identify seasonal campaigns and messaging shifts.
Use extracted insights as inspiration onlyâ€”always create original creative to respect intellectual property.
anti_patterns: Copying competitor ad copy or designs directly instead of adapting patterns to your brand.
Focusing on only one competitor instead of analyzing the broader competitive landscape.
Assuming ad frequency equals success without considering other factors like budget and campaign goals.

faq.question: Does this skill actually scrape ad platforms?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides a framework for analyzing competitor ads. You provide competitor names and platforms, and it guides research and analysis using Claude's capabilities.

faq.question: Which ad libraries can I research?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on Facebook Ad Library and LinkedIn. You can request research on any platform where you have access or information to share.

faq.question: Can I get engagement metrics for competitor ads?
faq.answer: This skill analyzes messaging and creative approaches. Performance data availability depends on what you provide or have access to.

faq.question: Is this legal to use?
faq.answer: Yes. Public ad libraries are designed for research. Use insights for inspiration onlyâ€”do not copy designs or copy directly.

faq.question: How many competitors can I analyze at once?
faq.answer: The skill supports multi-competitor analysis. For best results, analyze 3-5 competitors at a time to identify patterns effectively.

faq.question: How is this different from paid ad intelligence tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides strategic guidance using Claude's reasoning. Paid tools offer automated data collection. Use both together for comprehensive research.
